alert.note: Alert for Bay; Holmes; Jackson; Walton; Washington (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 18 at 1:40AM EDT until April 18 at 2:45AM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Western Jackson County in the Panhandle of Florida... Bay County in the Panhandle of Florida... Central Walton County in the Panhandle of Florida... Southern Holmes County in the Panhandle of Florida... Washington County in the Panhandle of Florida... * Until 145 AM CDT. * At 1239 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles south of De Funiak Springs to 8 miles east of Santa Rosa Beach to 26 miles southeast of Destin, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Panama City, Lynn Haven, Panama City Beach, Callaway, Vernon, De Funiak Springs, Bonifay, Chipley, Santa Rosa Beach, Springfield, Mexico Beach, Hiland Park, Tyndall Air Force Base, Eglin Air Force Base, Bradford, Union, Live Oak, Parker, Freeport and Ponce De Leon. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
